intro: Pavetta pumila, commonly known as the small pavetta, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to parts of Africa and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its fruit is a small capsule that contains several seeds. Pavetta pumila is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
